H0.text: who enforces the charter of rights and freedoms. Parliament

H1.text: who enforces the charter of rights and freedoms. The Prime Minister

H2.text: who enforces the charter of rights and freedoms. The Canadian Human Rights Commission

H3.text: who enforces the charter of rights and freedoms. courts

A4.text: The Supreme Court has the ultimate power of judicial review over Canadian federal and provincial laws' constitutional validity.

A5.text: If a law is declared contrary to certain sections of the Charter of Rights and Freedoms, Parliament or the provincial legislatures may make that particular law temporarily valid again against by using the 'override power' of the notwithstanding clause.
